summary:
I am an analytical scientist with extensive experience in analytical method development for the characterization of biopharmaceuticals (mAbs and ADCs) and QC implementation according to GMP regulations and ICH guidelines for release and stability testing of these products. Recently, I started applying my skillset to new chemical entities as well to expand my expertise.

I enjoy working together with colleagues to obtain a deeper understanding of our (new) products and production processes and see how it is all connected to ensure the desired product quality. I like projects that challenge me to combine my abilities to oversee the grand purpose and translating projects into efficient and practical plans. Especially projects that serve innovation and continues improvements keep my enthusiasm and energy level high. In the process I keep an eye on the long-term impact of each decision and make adjustments when new data and insights are obtained to ensure the best outcome. I always want expand and share my knowledge, learn what others can teach me and continue to improve myself.

Currently, I am leading the design and implementation of Analytical Quality by Design (AQbD) within the Analytical department, involved practically to enable structured data strategies and data management of analytical data, improving and expanding the use of statistical tools in method development and life-cycle management and design and execute method development for CE and (U)HPLC techniques with a focus on obtaining and maintaining high quality data. 

Specialties: Primarily capillary electrophoresis, statistics (e.g. DoE, data evaluation tools, trending) and Analytical Quality by Design (AQbD).  (U)HPLC techniques for the characterization and control of mAbs, ADCs and small molecules (e.g. AFF, SEC, peptide mapping, RP) . Using an open and effective communication to realize tasks.

currentPositions.title: Scientist, Biochemical analysis

headline: Scientist at Genmab

courses.name: Advanced CE method development, validation and troubleshooting
PerkinElmer E-notebook for Biologics: Structured Data and TIBCO Spotfire

publications.name: Switching positions: assessing the dynamics of conjugational heterogeneity in antibody-drug conjugates using CE-SDS

commentary.text: Thank you Carlos, for joining us as one of our speakers! 😊 CE you then!
